{"step_by_step_thinking": "Thrombolysis, or clot-busting therapy, is a treatment used to dissolve clots that have formed in the blood vessels of the brain in patients with acute ischemic stroke. The window period for thrombolysis is the time frame within which this treatment can be administered after the onset of stroke symptoms. According to the American Heart Association and the American Stroke Association, the window period for intravenous thrombolysis with alteplase (a type of clot-busting drug) is up to 4.5 hours after the onset of stroke symptoms.", "answer_choice": "D. 4.5 hours"}
